intro: Metrosideros pungens, commonly known as the flame tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that appear in clusters during the warmer months. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a fast-growing tree that can reach heights of up to 20 meters, making it a popular ornamental species. The bark is typically smooth and can peel in thin layers, revealing a reddish or brownish color underneath.
